title: How to search on Quora - Quora

response.answer_text: You can do a simple word search by clicking on the word and found look up. But folks Quora is not nor do I believe it to be intended to be a true “ SEARC ENGINE “ such as GOOGLE. Mostly it is a sort of opinion poll. But I see many people using and sort of abusing this site and it’s readers as a search engine. I got reprimanded by a reader ( and by Quora for not being nice) when I suggested they the questioner to look it up on google as i had to. The reader stated that they may not have access to Google. Not necessarily true. Quora is web based and you have to have internet access just as you do for any search engine. But I digress. Quora is not a true search engine. And many answers given may be factual. And then there are many that are personal opinions and based on personal experience. Some are very emotional answers. Some questions are not so much looking for true answers, but just to ask a question. Any questions. I affectionately caked those “ ONE OF THOSE QUESTIONS “. That I report as not looking for true answers. Many times u just pass these by , not worth my time to ever read. In my day we wanted to know something we went to the encyclopedia britanica. But that was about 50 years ago pre internet era.

"Add Question", at the top of Quora, doubles as a search box. It will search for questions similar to the one you're asking. I had the same question, but had to answer it myself in order to find this question.
